content.question:
Used by permissions

This illustration of an ancient stele from Chavín de Huántar demonstrates the use of contour rivalry through

choices.label: the use of ambiguous shapes that can be interpreted as multiple depictions of different forms
the inclusion of both frontal and profile views to present the figure’s full body
the use of repeated curling shapes to contrast with the vertical and horizontal lines in the image
the inclusion of abstract forms that imply the movements of the artist’s body

content.answer: the use of ambiguous shapes that can be interpreted as multiple depictions of different forms

topic.text: 5.2: Materials, Processes, and Techniques in Indigenous American Art

skill.text: Skill 5.B: In analyzing a work of art beyond the image set, explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, technique, and/or content shape a work of art (or group of related works of art).
